chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Voight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with probation in Walworth County File 22CF234.
**AMENDED 10/27/22 TO REFLECT 59 DAYS OF DEADTIME CREDIT IF REVOKED**

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
----------------------

No weapons, firearms, facsimile firearms, or ammunition.
----------------------

No contact with the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent. Absolute sobriety - No alcohol, drugs, (other than prescribed), or paraphernalia. Not to be in any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or places whose primary purpose is the sale/distribution of alcohol.
----------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

8:31am Court in session

Defendant Matthew Voight present in court, in custody with attorney Steven Spear. ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter is set for a preliminary hearing, Deft wishes to have a hearing.

State calls Officer Shaun Sowa, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Sowa. 
State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF232, into evidence. 
No objection by Atty Spear. Court receives exhibit #1
No Cross-Exam by Atty Spear
Officer Sowa excused. 

State calls Officer Xenia Rodriguez, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF311, into evidence. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Rodriguez. No objection by Atty Spear to the Court receiving exhibit #1. Court receives.
No cross-exam by Atty Spear.
Officer Rodriguez excused.

State calls Officer Antonio Gonzalez, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Gonzalez. State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF234, into  evidence. No objection by Atty Spear. Court receives.
No cross-exam by Atty Spear
Officer Gonzalez excused. 

No defense witnesses.

Record is closed.

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed & that the Deft likely committed it & binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
State makes record that informations will mirror complaints.

Defense proceeds with arraignment today.
Court orders NGI Exam.

Motion to modify bond by Defense.
State objects, further argument by ADA Herrmann. 
Response argument by Atty Spear
Deft's significant other present in court. 
Response argument by ADA Herrmann

Court makes record, Court denies bond motion, bond remains at this time.

8:52am Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defense Motion to Modify Bond

Called at 1:41 PM. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S. Voight in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Matthew S. Voight. Record by Attorney Spear to status of defendant. Attorney is questioning the defendant's competency. Attorney is asking that bond be modified to allow talk-texting per injunction. Objection by state. Victim is present in court and responds to court's questions. Court grants request - bond modified to allow phone calls or text messages while defendant is in custody. Court orders competency evaluation. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
